title: BPC’s Grumet to Testify Before Senate Energy and Natural Resources Committee
content: Washington, D.C.– Bipartisan Policy Center President Jason Grumet will testify before the Senate Energy and Natural Resources Committee this Thursday, February 7, during a hearing on the status of energy innovation in America. Also scheduled to appear are Undersecretary for Science Paul Dabbar, former Energy Secretary Ernest Moniz, and ClearPath founder Jay Faison, among others.Grumet will discuss the importance of federal investment in energy innovation and tout the work of the American Energy Innovation Council, a project of BPC. AEIC argues that the United States is losing a competitive edge internationally when it comes to developing next-generation energy technologies and that increased federal investment is key to changing that dynamic.Read Grumet’s ​Roll Call column calling for a Green “True” Deal.The hearing will be webcast live on the committee’s website.To arrange an interview with Jason Grumet, please email BPC Press Secretary Jordan LaPier at [email protected].WHAT: Senate Energy and Natural Resources Committee hearing WHEN:  Thursday, February 7, 10 a.m. ET WHERE: Dirksen Senate Office Building, Room 366 WHO: Jason Grumet, president of the Bipartisan Policy Center
